publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2885# Cathy Peattie: Hamish Henderson-That the Parliament notes with regret the death of Hamish Henderson and wishes to place on record its appreciation of his lifetime devotion to international solidarity, peace and socialism, his many contributions to Scottish culture and politics, including his role in gathering traditional songs, his support for other artists and his authorship of the song that many believe should be Scotland's (inter)national anthem, The Freedom Come All Ye.
S1M-2885# Hamish Henderson (lodged on 12 March 2002) Bill Butler*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2885# Hamish Henderson (lodged on 12 March 2002) Mrs Margaret Ewing*

S1M-2885# Cathy Peattie: Hamish Henderson—That the Parliament notes with regret the death of Hamish Henderson and wishes to place on record its appreciation of his lifetime devotion to international solidarity, peace and socialism, his many contributions to Scottish culture and politics, including his role in gathering traditional songs, his support for other artists and his authorship of the song that many believe should be Scotland’s (inter)national anthem, The Freedom Come All Ye. Supported by: Bill Butler, Tommy Sheridan, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Alex Neil*
S1M-2885# Hamish Henderson (lodged on 12 March 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Shona Robison*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2885# Hamish Henderson (lodged on 12 March 2002) Jackie Baillie*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr John McAllion*
S1M-2885# Hamish Henderson (lodged on 12 March 2002) Marilyn Livingstone*, Robin Harper*

S1M-2885# Cathy Peattie: Hamish Henderson—That the Parliament notes with regret the death of Hamish Henderson and wishes to place on record its appreciation of his lifetime devotion to international solidarity, peace and socialism, his many contributions to Scottish culture and politics, including his role in gathering traditional songs, his support for other artists and his authorship of the song that many believe should be Scotland’s (inter) national anthem, The Freedom Come All Ye. Supported by: Bill Butler, Tommy Sheridan, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Shona Robison, Donald Gorrie, Jackie Baillie, Mr Michael McMahon, Maureen Macmillan, Mr John McAllion, Marilyn Livingstone, Robin Harper
S1M-2885# Hamish Henderson (lodged on 12 March 2002) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-2885# Hamish Henderson (lodged on 12 March 2002) Pauline McNeill*, Karen Whitefield*
